instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No USB activity and <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> never drops voltage
threads.message: Clean boards all voltages are present including <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> but that voltage never changes and there is no USB activity, on a good board <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> drops from either 0.9V to 0.6V on the 00281 boards and drops from 1.1V to 0.7V on the 00928 boards, I will like to find out what to check on this boards before giving them back to customers, I know this CPUs fail a lot and will like to make sure for sure that the CPU is dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No USB activity and <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> never drops voltage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No USB activity and <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> never drops voltage
threads.message: I did on both of them, same exact result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No USB activity and <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> never drops voltage
threads.message:
Then should be something related with PCH, CPU, or even GPU.

Did you test in safe mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No USB activity and <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> never drops voltage
threads.message: I did not test in safe mode, one of them had a different behavior and it would go up to 1Amp + and stay there, the other one had a more normal amperage.
